title: Pulsefire Vayne
body:
http://i.gyazo.com/ef013c3193d29ad739c8e07defe12914.png
---
**Edit:** A rough translation of the text in the image: 

**【R】** - When Final Hour is active, she switches to the pulsefire cannon.
**【Q】** - The 'Dragoon System' noted in the image is meant to replace the original "black bats" effect while using tumble.
**【E】** - She quickly switches from the crossbow to the cannon to cast Condemn.
**【W】** - Before learning Silver Bolts, the crossbow will have a dim, metal color. It then gains an "ice blue light" after learning the skill to indicate it is active.
---
---

This skin concept has been brought up before (and a few of you may have already seen it), but I think it deserves more spotlight because it's just TOO damn good. A lot of other Vayne players have been expecting something badass for a long time since none of her current skins particularly stand out, but have been disappointed yet again by a release of another mediocre skin (Sorry rito but we're looking at Arclight)

It might be a while before she gets her next skin, but the idea remains incredible. It doesn't have to be called Pulsefire (can be Project: Vayne or whatever); this art is mainly to show how a mech'd-up, futuristic Vayne (in heels!) would look; and I personally think that this theme suits her more than anyone else. I see a lot of potential for this to be a legendary or even an ultimate skin.


**Edit 2:** I know she isn't a particle-heavy champion to begin with, this skin might just give her that 'spark' that she needs by shooting laser beams instead of arrows.
---

Without her dark hair/ponytail, tri-tip cape or high collar she doesn't really read as Vayne, I think she needs at least a couple of these features to be retained. I really like the big chunky weapon and Dead Space/Terran Ghost design language - I wish we could do something like that for a bunch of our champions.

A pulsefire/ghost skin makes the most sense on Caitlyn, but I think an early exploration of that concept ended up as Headhunter Caitlyn if I'm not mistaken. Having said that I can see a world where Vayne would have a skin like this.

Hm I don't think her hair is what makes her Vayne, but I somewhat agree with the cape. Although if this is supposed to be a legendary or an ultimate skin, isn't she supposed to have a completely different feel? (Forecast Janna or Omega Squad Teemo completely changed their personalities.) Not to mention, if the idea is supposed to be futuristic, I think a cape would look out of place.


Also, a question: What does it normally take for a skin concept to get implemented? 3 Rioters so far commented on the concept (IronStylus: http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=2011340&page=33) and the past thread garnered almost 1100 upvotes (see link in original post)

What exactly are you guys looking for in this subsection?

I guess the difference is that you still recognise Omega Squad Teemo as Teemo, and Forecast Janna is definitely Janna, but I don't recognise this character and go 'oh that's Vayne'. Maybe Quinn or... gender swap PFE? She doesn't need ALL of her defining qualities, but she does need some of them. Maybe keep the hair blonde but make it closer in silhouette to her base hair style, or feature a sfi-fi version of her collar etc. It's true as Saixos Yewark says in his post that the animation and pose goes a long way to making a character recognisable and that's something we discuss on the skins team a lot - just how far can we push things when it comes to identifying the champion?

I'm fairly new to the team, but when it comes to implementing concepts we usually have a direction or specific theme in mind when we start concepting and from there the team makes decisions as a whole about which direction to move in until we hit on something we are all really excited about executing on. The direction/theme and the champion are some times quite broad (come up with some champions that would fit into skin line "X") and other times very narrow (design "X" skin for "Y" champion). If it's broad and we are exploring some different options then we will often bring up fan concepts as a potential launching point (this surprise party fiddlesticks idea is amazing and popular, I'm going to do some designs on that theme and pitch them) or even just as a good talking point (maybe there is a theme that would work with another champion, or a theme we don't want to pursue but want to talk about why not). 

I feel the need to clarify that the boards aren't for submissions - we aren't 'looking for' anything. Not all Rioters are active on the boards either. Rather it's a place to share great ideas and art with other players that love the game as much as you do. I've been on the boards/forums since I started playing and I am one of those players that love the game, I'm just a Rioter now as well. I want to post often and sincerely because I remember what it is like before I was working on the other side of the curtain. Having said that I'm always checking the boards and other sites for awesome concepts and when I find one I definitely bring it up with the team because the community has kick ass ideas.

Wow, I wasn't expecting an in-depth explanation but I do appreciate it.

Thanks for clearing everything up though. I was under the false impression that you guys were looking for something just really, really, extraordinary before you implement something rather than just potential starting points for projects you develop yourselves.

I am a bit disappointed that none of the best concepts in these boards are ever gonna make it in the servers, but I'm hoping that you guys can get something great off of everyone's ideas in here and release something equally as good, if not better.

There are a heap of awesome ideas here for sure, but the design process is never just one person from start to finish. Even if we had a finished concept to present to the team we then take everyone's feedback and use it to make a great idea even better. You'll never see a concept from the board be made into a skin that looks exactly like the concept, but if someone designs a 'Pool Party Ziggs' that is really cool then you may indeed see a 'Pool Party Ziggs' skin in the future.

So basically, we won't see an exact design of a concept made into a skin, but an inspired version of that concept instead..

That makes sense. I guess every idea has always room for improvement. I'm hoping you guys don't throw this into the back burner though lol

They just can't copy the skin ideas because of lawsuits. Stupid people will put out a skin idea, then IF Riot were to make that skin later, the person who created the original skin idea would say that they're stealing their idea, and so forth. Then many lawsuits later... yeah.

I think I do remember, however, seeing some article about skins/concepts the community has helped make happen, and skins have been among them (AstroNautilus, if memory serves). So my question is, exactly how much community support does there really have to be for something like this to be made a reality?

What I was trying to say is that there is no exact quantity or quality but we do try to keep a finger on the pulse, and if something gets a lot of momentum then we seriously consider it. However there are a lot of skin concepts that never get made and a plethora of reasons why.
Ahh, okay. Well I will hope this one at least makes it through the pipeline. ;)
